value.title: Take Power BI data alerts to the next level with Microsoft Flow
value.excerpt: Patrick shows you how easy it is to use Microsoft Flow to take Power BI data alerts to the next level. Use Microsoft Flow to send to additional people.  Guy in a Cube Courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Technique to improve Power BI report perf by reducing visuals
value.excerpt: Having a lot of visuals in your Power BI Report can slow things down. Here's a technique you could employ to reduce visuals and improve performance. value.title: Test your Power BI DAX measures in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Learn how to get your DAX measures in working order, using DAX Studio, before putting them in your Power BI report. Patrick walks you through it!  SQLBI article: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/hiding-future-dates-for-calculations-in-dax/  Hiding Future Dates video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VXd1wl-5vKI

value.title: The BANANAS approach to use Power BI Bookmarks to swap tooltips
value.excerpt: Have you wanted to change the Power BI tooltips dynamically? This BANANAS trick allows you to at least switch the content of a report page tooltip to give you more flexibility and take your report to the next level!  Download Sample: http://guyinacu.be/swaptooltipsample  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Tracing with Log Analytics and Power BI
value.excerpt: With Log Analytics integration in Power BI, you can now capture Analysis Services trace events easily and over a longer period of time. Combined with the Power BI template report, you can gain a lot of insights into usage of your datasets. With more to come down the road!  Announcing long-term usage

value.title: Understanding the basics of Power BI Premium
value.excerpt: What is Power BI Premium? Let's look at how you can use it within Power BI. From benefits to how to acquire, this should get you up to speed. value.title: Visualize Graph Data in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you wondered how to visualize graph data? No, not Microsoft Graph. Graph Networks! Adam shows you how you can do this in Power BI Desktop.  Download sample: http://guyinacu.be/graphdatasample  Microsoft Graph API: https://docs.microsoft.com/graph/overview  Graphs and Networks https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/graph-and-network-algorithms.html

value.title: What is a Power BI tenant? (Office 365 / Azure Active Directory)
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at what a Power BI tenant is. This is really the Azure Active Directory / Office 365 tenant that contains your users, groups, subscriptions and more.   LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: When optimizing Power BI don't forgot about CPU
value.excerpt: We talk about optimizations a LOT! We pile onto a question posed by Chris Webb - Should you optimize for CPU in Power BI? We think the answer is YES! Let's explain...  Chris Webb's Blog: https://blog.crossjoin.co.uk/2021/09/19/why-you-should-optimise-your-power-bi-premium-reports-and-refreshes-for-cpu-time-as-well-as-duration/

value.title: Working with images in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to work with images in Power BI. He isn't talking about adding a logo into your report. This looks at how you can integrate visuals in your visuals based on your data.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)
